bio: Aaron Teich is a Kundalini yogi, meditation teacher, and healer. After graduating from Harvard University with a degree in Comparative Religion, he discovered Kundalini Yoga, studying with Yogi Bhajan, the Master of Kundalini Yoga, and with Guru Dev Singh, the Master of Sat Nam Rasayan® (SNR) - the healing tradition of Kundalini Yoga. To deepen his training, he later earned a Master’s degree in Chinese Medicine and traveled for one year to 12 countries to study with international healers. For the past decade, Aaron has offered classes and workshops in Kundalini Yoga, SNR, and meditation, in addition to maintaining his private healing practice.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Greenwich Village
description: If you're looking for a boost of energy and feeling a bit out-going you'll love Aaron's classes. He's super warm and accessible, which is great for a Kundalini teacher.
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: Healing Anger: The Power of Patience from a Buddhist Perspective How to Know God: The Yoga Aphorisms of Patanjali Shakti: An Introduction to Kundalini Maha Yoga
name: Aaron Teich

bio: Adreanna's first encounter with Buddhism was in a high school philosophy class where the discourses on The Heart Sutra rocked her worldview in an uncomfortable and exhilarating way. Following a subsequent decade of flirtation with meditation, she found her home at The Interdependence Project in NYC, where she completed their year-long teacher training immersion, and continues to study, practice and teach alongside those who inspire her path. She’s taught meditation as a practical tool for clarity and resilience to corporate offices, middle school students, and served as a lead coordinator of the Meditation Working Group at Occupy Wall Street, bringing daily practice to the volunteers at Zuccotti Park in 2011. When she's not on the cushion, she serves as an Executive Coach at The Institute for Compassionate Leadership, a Student Coach at The Institute for Integrative Nutrition, and catalyzes women to rally their resources so that they can find more freedom in business + life in her private coaching practice.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
description: You'll love Adreanna for her kind manner, and her ability to break down complex concepts into easily understandable material made her the prime candidate for Head Teacher at our UES location; great for newcomers.
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: Acorn by Yoko Ono Faith: Trusting Your Own Deepest Experience Rebel Buddha: A Guide to a Revolution of Mind
name: Adreanna Limbach

bio: As owner and teacher of Gaiatri Yoga Teacher Training, Ally Bogard has been leading yoga and meditation classes, retreats, immersions, and teacher trainings throughout the world for over ten years. Having first studied meditation through the Kriya and Tantric Yoga lineages, she continues to deepen her studies through insight, self-inquiry, and mindfulness meditation. Now based in New York City, she holds weekly group meditations for all levels of practitioners. Through great teachers and her studentship, she has cultivated a unique voice and a commitment to teach in a way that helps one become a clear vessel through which Higher Power can move for the service of others.
locations_label: Greenwich Village
name: Ally Bogard
author: Ellie
recommended_reading: Breaking The Habit of Being Yourself: How to Lose Your Mind and Create a New One Meditation for the Love of It: Enjoying Your Own Deepest Experience Self Observation: The Awakening of Conscience: an Owner's Manual
description: Ally is a special gift; her breath work is very unique amongst our MNDFL classes.

bio: Caroline is a writer and activist who first came to breath-based shamatha meditation in 2008. She has been teaching since she completed the Interdependence Project's Facilitator Training program in 2012. She created the Sound of Mind mindfulness of sound workshop which was held at ISA restaurant in Brooklyn, and held a weekly mindfulness class at the queer arts and community space The Spectrum, also in Brooklyn. She aims to bring a sense of humor and wonder to her classes, and hopes to create a gentle space for simply being with all the sounds and sensation of life in New York City.
locations_label: Upper East Side
description: Caroline's sense of humor and ability to place meditation in a contemporary context is a real treat.
author: Ellie
recommended_reading: Thoughts Without A Thinker: Psychotherapy from a Buddhist Perspective Turning the Mind Into an Ally The Way of Tenderness: Awakening through Race, Sexuality, and Gender
name: Caroline Contillo

bio: Chrissy Carter is a yoga educator, meditation teacher, writer, and lifestylist. As a senior teacher and teacher trainer at YogaWorks in New York, she has led a combined thirty-five 200hr and 300hr teacher trainings. Chrissy’s teaching style is rooted in her practice as a student of Iyengar yoga. She tempers clear, inspired teaching with space, light-heartedness and humor. She shares the art of mindful living on her blog, where she weaves philosophy into cooking, design, and everyday life. Chrissy has appeared in numerous publications including The New York Times, Yoga Journal, Live Happy, Shape, and Health Magazine. She has starred in two Gaiam yoga DVDs, and is a featured teacher on Gaia.com and Meditation Studio App.
locations_label: Greenwich Village
name: Chrissy Carter
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: A Path with Heart: A Guide Through the Perils and Promises of Spiritual Life Light on the Yoga Sutras of Patanjali Wherever You Go, There You Are
description: Chrissy comes from a yogic background, which makes her work with us really unique. She's the embodiment of presence and really kind

bio: David Perrin is a meditation teacher and mentor in the Shambhala tradition. He is a founding faculty member at MNDFL and the Institute for Compassionate Leadership and serves as Executive Director of MNDFL Ed., bringing mindfulness, compassion, and community building practices to NYC schools. David is a Licensed Creative Arts Therapist, and Registered Drama Therapist. He has worked as a psychotherapist for Creative Alternatives of New York, and Counseling In Schools, among other agencies. David is a founding Trustee at the Perrin Family Foundation, supporting youth to be catalysts for social justice. David lives in New York City with his partner Anne Kenan and their three children.
locations_label: Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
name: David Perrin
author: Ellie
recommended_reading: Natural Wakefulness: Discovering the Wisdom We Were Born With Ruling Your World: Ancient Strategies For Modern Life Smile at Fear: Awakening the True Heart of Bravery
description: There's a reason David became the Head Teacher for our Greenwich Village location - he has incredible presence, is extremely knowledgeable and specializes in getting a meditation practice going.

bio: Jackie Stewart is fascinated with interpersonal relationships and finding mutual understanding between humans. On retreat at a monastery in Nepal, she deeply connected with Tibetan Buddhist teachings and has been exploring the various lineages in earnest ever since. She is the host of the Interdependence Project’s interactive online meditation, Sit Anywhere Sundays, a platform that encourages engaged discussion and making practice accessible. Jackie brings mindfulness into action through involvement in social activism, leading corporate meditations, and philanthropic work. With an MA in Media, Culture, and Communication from NYU, she works at mindfully finding the balance between the outer world of the fashion & entertainment industries and an inner life of feeling "whole and enough.”
locations_label: Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
name: Jackie Stewart
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: Tao Te Ching: The New Translation from Tao Te Ching, The Definitive Edition (Tarcher Cornerstone Editions) The Mastery of Love: A Practical Guide to the Art of Relationship: A Toltec Wisdom Book The Art of Communicating
description: We've never had someone take Jackie's class and regret it. Her warmth and kind heart speaks volumes; great for newcomers.

bio: Joseph Mauricio is a teacher, speaker and coach who works with private clients, couples and groups. He offers motivational and meditation workshops in academic, business and private sectors. A senior meditation teacher of the Shambhala Buddhist Tradition, Joseph began his career twenty years ago at Karma Choling Buddhist Meditation Center in Vermont.  He has subsequently taught in schools, businesses, yoga, meditation, wellness and community centers throughout North America, Canada and Europe. He is the founder of  LIFEWORK SERVICES - Meditation based coaching, sits on the faculty of the Institute for Compassionate Leadership, is the founder of Dharmajunkies an engaged spiritual community, serves as the head meditation instructor for Warrior Bridge Aikidojo and is a co-director of THE WAKEFUL WARRIOR PROJECT, working to bring mindfulness training to veterans.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
description: Joe's classes are heavily guided, so if you're worried about sitting in silence for years on end no worries here. His sense of humor is incredible and he's simply a delight."
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: The Wisdom of No Escape and the Path of Loving-Kindness Work, Sex, Money: Real Life on the Path of Mindfulness Running with the Mind of Meditation: Lessons for Training Body and Mind
name: Joseph Mauricio

bio: Joshua Bee Alafia graduated from UC Santa Cruz in 1995 with a BA in Theatre Arts/Film. He currently is a filmmaker and has worked as a teaching artist teaching film, capoeira, tai chi and teaches mindfulness practice through the Lineage Project. He is a graduate of the Community Dharma Leaders training through Spirit Rock Meditation Center.  He currently teaches at New York Insight Meditation Center and leads the Brooklyn People of Color and Allies Meditation bimonthly sit every 2nd and 4th Monday at the Brooklyn Zen Center.
locations_label: Greenwich Village
name: Joshua Bee Alafia
author: Ellie
recommended_reading: Being Black: Zen and the Art of Living with Fearlessness and Grace (Compass) Dipa Ma: The Life and Legacy of a Buddhist Master Healing Anger: The Power of Patience from a Buddhist Perspective
description: Joshua Bee has a powerful presence but is sweet as can be. He has a real ability to speak truth in a direct way, and knows how to go deep with a meditation practice.

bio: Juan Carlos is a visual artist, creative director, yogi and explorer of reality. He was first exposed to meditation in 2004 when he met meditation teacher and author Ethan Nichtern. He grew passionate about Buddhist practice and became involved in the Interdependence Project, where he offered some time as a facilitator and meditation teacher in the early years. Simultaneously, Juan Carlos delevoped a strong heart connection to the Shambhala teachings and embarked on its Sacred Path of Warrior. He eventually became a student of Ponlop Rinpoche and a teacher of the Buddhist curriculum at his sangha, Nalandabodhi NY. In 2009 he met non-dual spiritual teacher Gangaji, who blew his mind open. Her teachings on Self-Inquiry, a direct investigation into the Truth of Self has become his focus and permeates his view of spiritual practice. He volunteers for the Gangaji Foundation as the curator of the online video library. Finally, he is also infinitely indebted to his Jivamukti yoga teachers Rima Rabbath and Monica Jaggi for 10 years of instilling the discipline of deepening in the precious practices of asana and meditation.
locations_label: Greenwich Village
name: Juan Carlos Castro
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: You Are That The Radiance Sutras: 112 Gateways to the Yoga of Wonder and Delight (English and Sanskrit Edition) The Diamond in Your Pocket: Discovering Your True Radiance
description: Juan Carlos is a MNDFL favorite due to his charm, wisdom, and warmth. A great teacher for new and old meditators alike!

bio: Kate Johnson is happiest when working at the intersections of spiritual practice, social action, and creative expression. Her style as a meditation teacher is clear, warm, and smart, encouraging stability and clarity of mind while bringing the heart a little closer to the surface. When she's not at MNDFL, Kate teaches mindful yoga and meditation in NYC public schools, Buddhist meditation at The Interdependence Project, and facilitates Social Presencing Theater, an embodied approach to organizational training and leadership development.  Kate has trained at Spirit Rock Meditation Center, The Interdependence Project, Laughing Lotus Yoga and The Presencing Institute.  She also holds a BFA in Dance from The Alvin Ailey School/Fordham University, and a MA in Performance Studies from NYU. www.katejohnson.com
locations_label: Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
name: Kate Johnson

bio: Kathy Cherry is a founding member of DharmaPunx NYC and has been teaching at the Sangha since 2010.   With practice and training grounded primarily in the Theravada tradition, she draws inspiration from contemporary culture, art and science to help contextualize ancient Buddhist concepts, making them relevant to our modern lives. Kathy’s teaching style emphasizes embodiment, compassion and practical wisdom both on and off the cushion.  “Most of us live from the shoulders up.   "We prefer the figuring out mind because it gives us the illusion of control.  Being awake to the madness and engaged in our choices is a revolutionary act.”
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
description: If you need some time to go deep with your practice you'll love Kathy; her classes are less guided than others but her instruction is precise and lovely.
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: The Mind Illuminated: A Complete Meditation Guide Integrating Buddhist Wisdom and Brain Science Search Inside Yourself: The Unexpected Path to Achieving Success, Happiness (and World Peace)
name: Kathy Cherry

bio: Kevin Townley is a writer/performer, and has been studying Buddhism since 2010. He currently practices with the Sokuko-Ji Zen community under the guidance of Kyoun Sokuzan. Kevin completed the Interdependence Project’s teacher training program in 2012. He works alongside Susan Piver to support her online community, The Open Heart Project. He is passionate about exploring the interplay of meditation and art-making while encouraging others to bring their own innate humor and insight to their meditation practice.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
description: Kevin is the consummate host; he immediately makes you feel at home and is great at answering any questions you may have; a good choice for newcomers.
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: The Myth of Freedom (Shambhala Classics) The Places that Scare You: A Guide to Fearlessness in Difficult Times (Shambhala Classics) Karma: What It Is, What It Isn't, Why It Matters
name: Kevin Townley

bio: Lodro Rinzler is the cofounder of MNDFL Meditation and is the award-winning author of seven books: The Buddha Walks into a Bar; Walk Like a Buddha; The Buddha Walks into the Office; Sit Like a Buddha; How to Love Yourself (And Sometimes Other People); Love Hurts; and How To Be Decent. He has taught meditation for seventeen years in the Buddhist tradition and travels frequently for his books, having spoken across the world at conferences, universities, and businesses as diverse as Google, Harvard University and the White House. Dubbed “the cool kid’s Buddhist” by The Boston Phoenix, Rinzler’s work has been featured in The New York Times,The Wall Street Journal, The Atlantic, FOX, CBS, and NBC. He lives in New York City with his wife Adreanna and a menagerie of small animals.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
description: Lodro is our Chief Spiritual Officer so everyone should take class with him! He wrote the book on meditation and modern living (actually, make that 6 books). If you're looking to figure out how meditation fits into everyday life and love a good dad joke, he's the teacher for you.
author: Ellie
recommended_reading: The Heart of the Buddha: Entering the Tibetan Buddhist Path (Shambhala Classics) Turning the Mind Into an Ally The Way of Tenderness: Awakening through Race, Sexuality, and Gender The Wisdom of No Escape and the Path of Loving-Kindness
name: Lodro Rinzler

bio: Maho Kawachi was born in Shibuya, Tokyo and has always thought of herself as the ultimate city girl, except for the three years when she lived among cows and ever-beer-drinking the OSU students in Columbus, OH. Living and practicing Buddhism in NYC gives her a constant challenge and a golden opportunity to become a good teacher. Her teaching style comes from the Tibetan Buddhism lineage with a modern tweak. She welcomes all sentient beings in her life, especially humans and dogs.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Greenwich Village
description: Maho is incredibly warm and approachable, and focuses particularly on the body and breath in her practice sessions.
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: Radical Acceptance: Embracing Your Life With the Heart of a Buddha The Road Home: A Contemporary Exploration of the Buddhist Path
name: Maho Kawachi

bio: Megan Mook specializes in meditation for emotional intelligence, with an emphasis on developing compassion. She holds a Masters in Buddhist Studies from the International Buddhist College in Thailand, and has studied Tibetan scriptural translation with Dr. Robert Thurman and Lozang Jamspal of Columbia University. For Megan, meditation is about connecting more meaningfully to our selves and to others.  Because everyone’s mind and heart is different, Megan encourages a one-on-one approach to learning meditation when possible. She offers drop-in classes, trainings, and one-on-one coaching in New York City.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
description: Megan's way of teaching MNDFL Heart may be our most popular version, and her embodiment of that love and kindness is what made her the perfect fit as Head Teacher at our Williamsburg location.
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: Reconciliation: Healing the Inner Child The Joy of Living: Unlocking the Secret and Science of Happiness A Force for Good: The Dalai Lama's Vision for Our World
name: Megan Mook

bio: Melissa McKay is a yoga and meditation teacher and former owner of Kusala Yoga in Brooklyn. She began her meditation practice in 1998 in California and sat her first intensive retreat with Sayadaw U Pandita of Burma in 1999 and has been participating in retreats annually ever since then. She travelled to Burma for her first intensive practice there in 2000. After moving to New York City she continued to practice at IMS where she attends retreats regularly mostly with her teacher Bhante Khippa Pano. She began sharing meditation practice in 2005. She teaches annual retreats regularly with Josh Korda of Dharma Punx NYC. Her intention for teaching is to encourage her students to cultivate the invaluable gifts of mindfulness and lovingkindness in every moment of their lives.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
description: You will definitely enjoy Melissa's classes, as she has such a precise and heartfelt way of offering her teachings. If you're looking for a bit more space in your practice session I definitely recommend her classes.
author: Ellie
recommended_reading: Dipa Ma: The Life and Legacy of a Buddhist Master The Heart of Buddhist Meditation: The Buddha's Way of Mindfulness In This Very Life : The Liberation Teachings of the Buddha
name: Melissa McKay

bio: Pandit Dasa is an inspirational speaker, meditation teacher, and well-being expert. He has conducted stress management workshops and meditation sessions in corporations such as Google, JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Intel, Novartis, Columbia and many other institutions. Through these workshops and practices of mindfulness, Pandit helps individuals lower stress and anxiety, increasing focus and productivity, and develop positive perspectives on challenging situations. Pandit has spoken at a TEDx conference and has been featured on PBS, NPR, The New York Times, and writes for The Huffington Post. In his book, Urban Monk, Pandit writes about the turning point in his life that came after his family lost their multimillion-dollar business, which caused them to lose everything. This served as a catalyst for Pandit’s journey that would take him from Los Angeles, to post-Communist Bulgaria, to a monastery in Mumbai, India. Pandit spent 15 years in New York City living as a monk. He uses his training and experiences to help corporate and student audiences manage stress and develop a work-life balance.
locations_label: Greenwich Village
name: Pandit Dasa
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: Urban Monk: Exploring Karma, Consciousness, and the Divine
description: Pandit is one of our Hindu teachers and his ability to articulate the way that meditation aides us in daily life is simply fascinating.

bio: Ralph is a psychotherapist, meditation provocateur, yoga instructor, musician, and writer. He  is the founder of The Mindfulness Sessions, a weekly class devoted to neuroscience- and psychology-informed techniques for clarifying and strengthening the mind. Ralph began practicing meditation within the bhakti yoga tradition in 1996 and became a student of Amma (Mata Amritananda Mayi) in 2000. He began studying Buddhism in 2005 and owes a debt of gratitude to both the Insight Meditation and Shambhala lineages. Ralph has taught meditation since 2008 and holds a Master of Social Work degree from Fordham University.
locations_label: Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
name: Ralph De La Rosa
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: Peace Is Every Step: The Path of Mindfulness in Everyday Life Touching Enlightenment: Finding Realization in the Body When Things Fall Apart: Heart Advice for Difficult Times (20th Anniversary Edition)
description: Ralph's Emotions classes are unparalleled. Combining his background as a therapist with a deep knowledge of Buddhism he is especially good at talking about the inner workings of the mind; great for newcomers.

bio: Sara Auster is a certified Sound Therapy Practitioner and meditation teacher based in New York City.  She has been a driving force in bringing sound meditation and sound therapy to contemporary culture.  Sara offers sound meditation in different formats including workshops, retreats, trainings, private sessions and large-scale events all over the world. Using holistic approaches to healing with the transformative power of music and sound, Sara's carefully crafted personal instruction allows her students and clients to use sound as a tool to support, access, and cultivate deep relaxation. Sara is the Sound Director of MNDFL and The Big Quiet, and offers sound events at venues such as The Rubin Museum, The Museum of Modern Art, Lincoln Center and Summer Stage in Central Park.  Sara co-created the Mindful Music + Sound Series at Tibet House, and serves on their associate board.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
description: Sara is the Beyonce of Sound. Try her Sound class or go deep with a sound bath and you won't regret it.
author: Ellie
recommended_reading: Healing at the Speed of Sound: How What We Hear Transforms Our Brains and Our Lives The World Is Sound: Nada Brahma: Music and the Landscape of Consciousness The Mysticism of Sound and Music (Shambhala Dragon Editions) Still the Mind: An Introduction to Meditation
name: Sara Auster

bio: Yael Shy is Senior Director of Global Spiritual Life at New York University and is the Founder and Director of the award-winning MindfulNYU, one of the largest campus-wide mindfulness initiatives in the country. She is the author of the book, "What Now? Meditation for Your Twenties and Beyond" (Parallax, Nov. 7, 2017) Yael teaches and lectures on mindfulness, meditation, and multifaith engagement privately and at universities, community centers, and organizations across the globe. She is certified in Jewish Meditation Instruction by the Institute for Jewish Spirituality and was a co-founder of the Jewish Meditation Center in Brooklyn in 2008. In 2010, Yael was named one of the “36 under 36” changemakers transforming the Jewish world by The Jewish Week newspaper.
locations_label: Greenwich Village
name: Yael Shy
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: Lovingkindness: The Revolutionary Art of Happiness (Shambhala Classics) Open to Desire: The Truth About What the Buddha Taught Zen Mind, Beginner's Mind
description: Yael's classes are all so unique; combining her knowledge of Judaism and Buddhism her work is soulful and inspires peace.

bio: David Booz is a long-time student of Tibetan Buddhism under his teacher Dzogchen Ponlop Rinpoche.  He is the Co-Director of Nalandabodhi New York, where he teaches meditation and facilitates the Buddhist study curriculum. In addition, David is a graduate of The Interdependence Project (IDP) 2011 Meditation Teacher Training.
locations_label: Greenwich Village
name: David Booz
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: One City: A Declaration of Interdependence Turning the Mind Into an Ally Rebel Buddha: A Guide to a Revolution of Mind
description: David is newer to MNDFL but has quickly become a fan-favorite due to his clear articulation of how to launch a meditation practice; great for newcomers.

bio: Born in Haiti, Thupten Phuntsok (Irnst Norgaisse) came to New York with his two sisters when he was nine years old and was ordained as a novice monk by Sermey Khensur Lobsang Tharchin Rinpoche in 1993. He received his Full Ordination (Gelong) the following year. Phuntsok has been a formal student of Buddhism for over 30 years. He started his formal Buddhist education under the guidance of Kyongla Rato Rinpoche, the tenth reincarnation of the Kyongla line and eight years later he met his main teacher, the late Sermey Kensur Rinpoche Geshe Lobsang Tharchin. He studied all the stages of the path under the direct guidance of Sermey Kensur Rinpoche Geshe Lobsang Tharchin until his passing in 2004. He has been teaching Buddhist philosophy and meditation for over 20 years.
locations_label: Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
name: Thupten Phuntsok
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: The Key to the Treasury of Shunyata: Dependent Arising and Emptiness ; Commentaries by Sermey Khensur Lobsang Tharchin Sermey Khensur Tharchin (Multilingual Edition) The Essence of Mahayana Lojong Practice: An Oral Commentary to Geshe Langri Tangpa's Mind Training in Eight Verses Mindfulness in Plain English
description: One time a community member told me that looking into Phuntsok's eyes was one of the most significant experiences of her life...whoa.

bio: Anne has been leading children and adults in yoga and meditation for the past 11 years. She is a devoted student and practioner of Shambhala Buddhism and has led the NY Shambhala Children’s Program for the past 8 years while serving as a part of the growing community of teachers there. Her interest in meditation grew out of her yoga asana practice 20 years ago and she is an certified yoga instructor in the Vajra Yoga tradition. As a mother of three children, Anne finds joy and inspiration in nature, creative expression and the tenderness of the human experience.  She is excited to share her passion and curiosity around working with one’s heart and mind.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
description: Anne is the kind of teacher you want to hang out with over a warm cup of tea after class (and the good news is that she's down for that).
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: The Path Is the Goal: A Basic Handbook of Buddhist Meditation The Posture of Meditation When Things Fall Apart: Heart Advice for Difficult Times (20th Anniversary Edition)
name: Anne Kenan

bio: Valerie Oula is a a KRI certified Kundalini yoga and meditation teacher, a Reiki master teacher and a former casting director. Her classes and workshops are down-to-earth and whimsical and her path is to help others create a space of inner sanctuary and spaciousness within through the tools of meditation, yoga and vibrational healing. She is the founder of Modern Ritual NYC, a line of luxe artisanal energetic creations for mind, body & soul.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Greenwich Village
description: Valerie has been called one of the most approachable and accessible Kundalini teachers in all of NYC and, well, she rocks.
author: Ellie
recommended_reading: The Untethered Soul: The Journey Beyond Yourself A Practical Guide to Vibrational Medicine: Energy Healing and Spiritual Transformation The Kundalini Yoga Experience: Bringing Body, Mind, and Spirit Together
name: Valerie Oula

bio: Nate Martinez is a certified Sound Therapy Practitioner and accomplished professional musician and producer based in New York City. He has studied shamanism and intuitive healing, and earned his sound therapy certification from New York’s Open Center. Martinez leads sound baths and meditations for individuals, groups, and companies, and, in addition to MNDFL, regularly teaches and facilitates sound baths at Sky Ting, Brooklyn Yoga Club, and Brooklyn Zen Center. Martinez’s work in sound meditation and sound therapy has been integral in growing an awareness of the field, and he has been featured in Vogue, Prevention, New York magazine, the Huffington Post, Well + Good, Yahoo Health, and MindBodyGreen, among others.
locations_label: Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
name: Nate Martinez
author: Ellie
recommended_reading: Spiritual Unfoldment 1: How to Discover the Invisible Worlds and Find the Source of Healing (Spiritual Unfoldment) (v. 1) Shaman, Healer, Sage: How to Heal Yourself and Others with the Energy Medicine of the Americas The Mysticism of Sound and Music (Shambhala Dragon Editions)
description: Nate's style of MNDFL Sound and sound baths are very unique and he often uses his own voice (um, it sounds like another instrument). If you like sound work you'll love him.

bio: Mark is a certified independent teacher of Vedic Meditation and the founder of Alchemy Collective. He discovered this practice after experiencing the debilitating effects of PTSD. After seven years of practicing, he eventually trained with Ziva Meditation and other Vedic Masters for 15 months to become a qualified teacher. With a background of over 20 years in the entertainment industry, including ten Broadway shows and film and T.V., he’s excited to bring his passion for service and teaching to those with high performance careers and lives. As a performance coach, he’s developed programs such as Base Camp for creatives. He’s honored to help others integrate this simple stress-relieving tool to maximize performance and increase fulfillment.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Greenwich Village
description: Mark's humor and presence is so touching. As one of our Vedic teachers, he does an amazing job of repping this ancient tradition.
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: Oneness The War of Art: Break Through the Blocks and Win Your Inner Creative Battles Catching the Big Fish: Meditation, Consciousness, and Creativity: 10th Anniversary Edition
name: Mark Price

bio: Alex Falk is a certified sound therapy practitioner, musician, audio producer, emcee and educator. Since 2013, Alex has been facilitating public sound baths and large scale meditation events individually, and with his long time partner (sound therapy practitioner and meditation teacher) Sara Auster.  He is a continuing facilitator for the Big Quiet, and has partnered with meditation and wellness programs like Medi-Club, Ziva Meditation, and Sound Off NYC.  He has offered sound baths at venues such as Lincoln Center, the Rubin Museum and Central Park Summer Stage. In 2014 he left his job in the music industry and began introducing the healing and transformative power of sound to one of NYC's most underserved populations, our public school students. He has since brought mindfulness and mediation programs into public elementary and high schools across the 5 boroughs.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
description: Alex is a sound genius. He's darn good on the ones and twos...which is what I call the multiple sound bowls he plays for a sound bath.
author: Lodro
recommended_reading: This Is Your Brain on Music: The Science of a Human Obsession Elements of the Real in Man (Diamond Heart, Book 1) The Hermetic Tradition: Symbols and Teachings of the Royal Art
name: Alex Falk

bio: Colin Beavan is the author, most recently, of "How to Be Alive: A Guide To The Kind of Happiness That Helps The World." He attracted international attention for his year-long lifestyle-redesign project and the wildly popular book, "No Impact Man," and the Sundance-selected documentary film that it inspired. He has appeared on Nightline, Good Morning America, The Colbert Report, The Montel Williams Show, and NPR, and his story has been featured in news outlets from Time magazine to the New York Times. A sought-after speaker by wide-ranging audiences, he also consults with individuals and organizations on living and operating in ways that marry prosperity with the promotion of peace, happiness, justice, right action and good will. He is a senior dharma teacher in the Kwan Um School of Zen.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading: How to Be Alive: A Guide to the Kind of Happiness That Helps the World No Impact Man: The Adventures of a Guilty Liberal Who Attempts to Save the Planet, and the Discoveries He Makes About Himself and Our Way of Life in the Process Dropping Ashes on the Buddha: The Teachings of Zen Master Seung Sahn
name: Colin Beavan

bio: Scott Tusa is a meditation teacher and mentor who first encountered Buddhism while attending Berklee College of music in his early twenties. He has trained in meditation and Buddhist philosophy for over twenty years,and with some of the greatest Tibetan Buddhist masters of our time. Ordained by His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama, he spent nine years as a Buddhist monk, with much of that time engaged in solitary meditation retreat and study in the United States, India, and Nepal. He has taught Buddhist philosophy and meditation extensively throughout North America in both group and one-to-one settings, and aims to combine the time-tested wisdom of the Buddhist path with the insight needed to address our modern lives.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading: The Myth of Freedom and the Way of Meditation (Shambhala Classics) Open Heart, Open Mind: Awakening the Power of Essence Love The Universe in a Single Atom: The Convergence of Science and Spirituality
name: Scott Tusa

bio: Marisa Viola first stepped onto the path of Buddhism during a solo journey to Thailand in 2008, where she visited temples galore and met many Buddhist practitioners. Struck by the kind, alert and open-hearted nature of so many of the Buddhists that she met, she began studying and practicing as soon as she returned to the big bad city. Her first stop was the Shambhala Meditation Center of NY. She studied at The Interdependence Project, took their year-long teacher training program in 2012, and began leading their open sits upon graduation. She has taught caregivers of cancer patients at NYU Hospital, student groups at NYU, and currently teaches inmates at Rikers Island Prison. She is also a writer, actor and filmmaker, and is interested in the creativity of every day life.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading: Radical Dharma: Talking Race, Love, and Liberation The Myth of Freedom and the Way of Meditation (Shambhala Classics) Reconciliation: Healing the Inner Child
name: Marisa Viola

bio: Dan fell in love with mindfulness in his early 20s when he was having what people now-a-days call a quarter life crisis. Everything seemed to be going great from the outside: a Harvard grad, working for LA times, great relationship, making good money, but something didn't feel right. A 14 hour bus ride; an encounter with an old friend who studied Taoism; a boat ride to Stone Island off the coast of Mazatlan; and meeting a monk who taught him how to meditate changed the course of his life. He went to India for 10 months where he practiced regularly and upon returning to NY became a middle school teacher and administrator where he taught both parents and kids ways to work more skillfully with their own minds. A practitioner of Theravadan Buddhism for a decade and a half, Dan continues to find the practice of meditation awareness-expanding and heart-deepening. He has participated in MBSR, Search Inside Yourself, Mindful Schools, and iBMe teacher training. When not being amused by his own mind, Dan enjoys hiking, reading the Buddha and Rumi, yoga, listening to jazz, finding really good cheap food, and board games.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading: The Experience of Insight: A Simple and Direct Guide to Buddhist Meditation (Shambhala Dragon Editions) The Dhammapada: A New Translation of the Buddhist Classic with Annotations The Essential Rumi, New Expanded Edition
name: Dan Vazquez

bio: Beatrice Anderson is a community organizer, meditation facilitator, ritual leader, and artist who champions restorative and healing justice. She is co-founder of the Love Circle Sangha, a BIPOC (Black, Indigenous and People of Color) + White Comrade community in the Plum Village tradition actively engaged in anti-oppression through practicing the dharma.  She also acts as core collective member with Harriet’s Apothecary, a healing village led by Black healers committed to co-creating accessible liberatory restorative spaces. Beatrice is co-founder and partner of InVision Contemplative Collective, an independent publishing house and whole community wellness incubator. Her mindfulness background is rooted in both Zen and the contemplative practices of earth based-Indigenous spirituality. Beatrice served as the Director for youth mindfulness program, Awake Youth at the Brooklyn Zen Center (2014-2016), has taught introductory and meditation courses, lead and facilitated retreats for adults and youth alike with various mindfulness and arts based organizations/institutions. Along with teaching and organizing, her artistic works as a musician and process artist have been featured internationally at the Whitney, Brooklyn Museum and Rotterdam. Her newest exploration, Ratchet Dharma - #Unapologetically Mindful, explores with fellow dhamra teachers, yogis and contemplatives the possibility of co-creating accessible and sustainable self and community care with Millennials at colleges and universities across the country, through a social art process piece.
locations_label: Greenwich Village
name: B Anderson
recommended_reading: Teaching Community: A Pedagogy of Hope Of Water and the Spirit: Ritual, Magic and Initiation in the Life of an African Shaman (Compass) Zen Mind, Beginner's Mind: Informal Talks on Zen Meditation and Practice

bio: Janusz Welin is a Brooklyn based mindfulness meditation teacher specializing in creativity practices, emotional and group intelligence practices, and is supportive of the many ways meditation can facilitate social justice work. Janusz has nearly a decade of dedicated mindfulness practice in the insight meditation tradition. He specializes in one-on-one meditation mentorship and developing custom meditation courses and strategies for individuals and organizations.Janusz is a teacher of secular mindfulness through Shinzen Young's Unified Mindfulness system and has also been empowered to teach by Spirit Rock Insight Meditation Center. He is empowered through Against the Stream Buddhist Meditation Society as a Meditation Mentor.
locations_label: Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
name: Janusz Welin
recommended_reading: The Science of Enlightenment: How Meditation Works When Awareness Becomes Natural: A Guide to Cultivating Mindfulness in Everyday Life The Body Keeps the Score: Brain, Mind, and Body in the Healing of Trauma

bio: Ellie Cobb, Ph.D. is a Columbia University trained psychologist, mindfulness meditation teacher, and holistic wellness expert. She is passionate about empowering others to improve their own well-being through scientifically-backed techniques, such as mindfulness. Having trained with Jack Kornfield, Tara Branch, and Jon Kabat-Zinn, Ellie has been teaching meditation and mindfulness for almost a decade to all ages in schools, studios, hospitals, clinics, corporations, and beyond. As a Holistic Psychologist and certified mind-body practitioner, Ellie’s approach integrates psychology and neuroscience and highlights the inherent connection between the mind and the body. She is a published researcher and author on mindfulness. Dr. Cobb sees clients in private practice in Soho. In addition, Ellie shares her expertise of mindfulness and mental wellness by leading workshops, giving talks, writing, teaching, and consulting through her wellness company, *Grounded & Gold.*
name: Ellie Cobb
recommended_reading: Buddha's Brain: The Practical Neuroscience of Happiness, Love, and Wisdom Mindsight: The New Science of Personal Transformation A Path with Heart: A Guide Through the Perils and Promises of Spiritual Life

bio: Rakhel Shapiro has over a decade of dedicated mindfulness practice in the insight meditation and Unified Mindfulness traditions. Her approach draws from Shinzen Young’s "four quadrants" of practice: to appreciate self and world, transcend self and world, transform self and world, and express the benefits of practice in our thoughts, words, and actions. She balances an insight/liberation driven focus with cultivation of deep caring, empowering students to transcend unnecessary suffering, and nourish connected and meaningful lives. She specializes in one-on-one Mindfulness-Based Mentorship for emotional intelligence, cultivating relationships with yourself and others, and liberation. Her work is informed by specialized training in attachment-oriented mindfulness practices and motivational interviewing. Rakhel is a certified Meditation Mentor through Mettagroup and Against the Stream Buddhist Meditation Society, and a teacher in Shinzen's Unified Mindfulness system. She holds a BA with Highest Honors from Vassar College, and is currently a PhD student in clinical psychology at Long Island University - Brooklyn.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading: The Science of Enlightenment: How Meditation Works Wired for Dating: How Understanding Neurobiology and Attachment Style Can Help You Find Your Ideal Mate The Body Keeps the Score: Brain, Mind, and Body in the Healing of Trauma
name: Rakhel Shapiro

bio: Ashley Dinges is a a meditation teacher based in NYC, empowered to lead Buddhist practices from the Shambhala lineage and by her teacher Sakyong Mipham Rinpoche. In additional to her work as a meditation teacher, Ashley is an award-winning marketing and communications executive. She serves as the Director of Communications for Shambhala International and holds an MBA from the NYU Stern School of Business. She is particularly interested in the intersection of contemplative practice with our everyday lives, careers, and relationships.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading: Turning the Mind Into an Ally Work, Sex, Money: Real Life on the Path of Mindfulness The Buddha Walks into a Bar.: A Guide to Life for a New Generation
name: Ashley Dinges

bio: Amanbir is a licensed acupuncturist and yoga therapist with over 13 years experience of teaching Kundalini Yoga. He is the director and a head trainer in both level 1 and level 2 Kundalini Yoga Teacher Trainings around the world with his mentor Gurmukh.  He brings his sense of humor, uplifting music, and extensive knowledge of the healing field into every class.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading: The Fruits of the Tree of Life : The Cabbalistic Tradition (Complete Works : Vol 32) The Yellow Emperor's Classic of Medicine: A New Translation of the Neijing Suwen with Commentary The Divine Doctor, Healing Beyond Medicine
name: Amanbir Singh

bio: A meditation practitioner for nearly 20 years, Justin has been teaching meditation since 2006 in the US, Europe, and online. His meditation roots are in Tibetan Buddhism (Chagdud Gonpa Sangha), in which he completed a Bodhisattva Peace Training and 18 months of personal retreat. He is a graduate of Byron Katie’s School for "The Work," an inquiry-based stress reduction technique which he facilitates professionally. Justin is also a graduate of Yale, where he obtained an MFA in playwriting, and of the Sorbonne, where obtained a MA in theater.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading: A Mind at Home with Itself: How Asking Four Questions Can Free Your Mind, Open Your Heart, and Turn Your World Around The End of Your World: Uncensored Straight Talk on the Nature of Enlightenment Being Aware of Being Aware (The Essence of Meditation Series)
name: Justin Taylor

bio: Ariel began meditating in 2011 with the hopes of better managing the anxiety she experienced as a young professional artist living and working in New York City. As a practitioner, she has formally studied in both the Vedic and Tibetan Buddhist traditions. Her approach to teaching is practical, heart-based and motivated by the desire to help the Millenial generation cultivate greater self-awareness and emotional intelligence. She also works full time as the Regional Director for SoulCycle, where she coaches leaders across the organization on bringing a mindful and compassionate approach to business driving, hospitality management and personal development. She is a proud graduate of MNDFL's inaugural teacher training program, and recently completed her advanced level certification under the guidance of Lodro and her mentor, Adreanna Limbach.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading:
Radical Acceptance: Embracing Your Life with the Heart of a Buddha by Tara Brach
The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment by Eckhart Tolle
The Nature of Personal Reality by Jane Roberts
name: Ariel Dobshinsky

bio: Russell Kummer first encountered Theravada Buddhism and Insight Meditation after signing up for a weekend retreat on a whim in 2013. Since then he has continued to study and practice in the Theravada tradition, and has been further enriched by the Tibetan tradition through the wonderful teachers at MNDFL. He loves to take his mind to the gym every day to workout his concentration and awareness muscles. He is a graduate of Columbia Business School and UC Berkeley and works in media and technology.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading:
Mindfullness in Plain English: 20th Anniversary Edition
Bhante Henepola Gunaranta
Mindfulness: A Practical Guide to Awakening - Joseph Goldstein
Radical Acceptance by Tara Brach
name: Russell Kummer

bio: Ray began his journey into mindfulness in 2004 when he visited Japan, and experienced his first silent retreat at a Buddhist monastery.  Naturally drawn to Asian cultures, he eventually started his own daily meditation practice as a way to cope with the stress of corporate life and entrepreneurship. He has since become a passionate advocate for the practice of meditation as an effective tool for improving health and well-being. Teaching at events and offices in New York City, he enjoys encouraging others to be kind to themselves through mindful living and self-discovery. He is also a facilitator for the Community of Mindfulness New York Metro. Having completed MNDFL’s advanced level Teacher Training Program, and with a background in international business and marketing, Ray is the founder of multiple startups, including his latest project, a line of mindfully-made meditation goods for the modern home, called  r e n o o (renoo.life).
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading:
You are here by Thich Nhat Hanh
Making Space: Creating a Home Meditation Practice  by Thich Nhat Hanh
Zen Mind, Beginner's Mind by Shunryū Suzuki
The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment by Eckhart Tolle
name: Ray Joliceour

bio: Jessica Angima is a first generation, Kenyan-American meditation instructor and arts administrator. Since completing a 300-hour training, she has been leading loving-kindness and shamatha practices throughout New York City. In February 2017, she co-founded the People of Color Meditation Sit at MNDFL. She has taught at SELF Magazine, MediClub and the Museum of Contemporary African Diasporan Arts. In addition to her work in mindfulness, Jessica is a 2019 Masters in Arts Politics candidate at NYU Tisch School of the Arts and serves as Program Coordinator to the Downtown Brooklyn Arts Management Fellowship. Currently based in Brooklyn, she hopes to merge her work in meditation and the arts to bring about social and political change.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading:
Radical Dharma: Talking Race, Love and Liberation by Rev. angel Kyodo williams Sensei, Lama Rod Owens and Dr. Jasmine Syedullah
What Now? Meditation for Your Twenties and Beyond by Yael Shy
Lovingkindness by Sharon Salzberg
name: Jessica Angima

locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
name: Danny Weiss

bio: Basia is a classically trained flutist and has been a professional musician for over 20 years. She received her MA in music performance. Her passion for music expanded beyond performing and teaching,as she developed profound interest in learning about healing and transformational affects of sound and music. Basia has studied different modalities of sound healing with teachers such as Grammy nominated Silvia Nakkach, renowned sound theorist Dr. John Beaulieu, the Great Gong Master Don Conreaux, earning a sound practitioner certification from New York's Open Center. She is very passionate and committed to bringing sound and its therapeutic effects to a broader audience. She has private practice and is a Sound Therapy Practitioner on Open Center’s Wellness team. Collaborations include: Rubin Museum, NY Yoga + Life Magazine, Conscious Campus, bringing sound work to college students in form of presentations and direct sound experience, monthly sound meditation at Mindful Harlem, Fashion Institute of Technology- series of creative enhancement workshops, the Big Quiet- the mass meditation movement and You Can Thrive- bringing therapeutic sounds to cancer patients and survivors among others.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading: Letting go by David R. Hawkins, MD.,Ph.D. - Healing at the Speed of Sound by Don Campbell and Alex Doman - Mysticism of Sound and Music by Hazrat Inayat Khan
name: Basia Blonska

locations_label: Upper East Side, Williamsburg, Greenwich Village
name: Neil D'Astolfo

bio:
Anita was first introduced to Buddhism when her mother gifted her Zen Mind Beginners Mind as a young teen. While it was all well over her head at the time, it sparked a lifelong interest in Eastern thought and philosophy. Now, she finds herself a student of Shambhala Buddhism, while still learning and appreciating the wisdom from many other Buddhist lineages. 
As Anita transitions from elementary school teacher to Art Therapist, she remains grounded in her passion to incorporate a sense of childlike wonder to all aspects of her day. She is excited about the opportunity to combine her interests in meditation, psychology and the creative process to help others navigate their inner and outer worlds.
locations_label: Upper East Side, Greenwich Village
recommended_reading:
Becoming What You Are—Alan Watts
When Things Fall Apart- Pema Chodron
Loving-Kindness in Plain English: The Practice of Metta-Bhante Henepola Gunaratana
name: Anita Battagliola
